alert.note: Alert for Central Interior (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 04 at 12:40PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Tanana River from Old Minto to Manley Hot Springs * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...The Tanana River is near bankfull from Old Minto to Manley Hot Springs. Minor flooding is possible of low-lying areas near the river. Water levels will remain high this week. For those recreating or hunting on the Tanana, all gravel bars will be covered with water, debris will be in the river, along with increased erosion. Be cautious of rising water levels if you plan to park your vehicle near the river while out on your boat. A Flood Advisory is currently in effect until Wednesday from Nenana to Old Minto. Please see that product for more details. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain that fell over the Alaska Range the past week is causing high water on the Tanana River. The river is expected to fall very slowly this week, but will fluctuate slightly with rainfall over the next several days. - Http://www.weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Tanana River from Old Minto to Manley Hot Springs stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
